item.title: Princess add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "Behind every trial and sorrow that He makes us shoulder, God has a reason." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Princess add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "Sometimes you have to be apart from people you love, but that doesn't make you love them any less. Sometimes you love them more." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "When you love someone, you don't want to hurt them, even if they deserve to be hurt. When you love someone, you want to hurt them, even when they don't deserve to be hurt." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "Taking no chances means wasting your dreams.." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "Forever has no meaning when you're living in the moment. I wasn't ready for that moment to end." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "Wish you could turn off the questions, turn off the voices, turn off all sound. Yearn to close out the ugliness, close out the filthiness, close out all light. Long to cast away yesterday, cast away memory, cast away all jeapordy. Pray you could somehow stop uncertainty, somehow stop the loathing, somehow stop the pain. Act on your impulse, swallow the bottle, cut a little deeper, put the gun to your chest." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description:
"Memory is a tenuous thing. . . .
flickering glimpses, blue and white, like ancient, decomposing 16mm film. Happiness escapes me there, where faces are vague and yesterday seems to come tied up in ribbons of pain.
Happiness? I look for it intead in today, where memory is something I can still touch, still rely on. I find it in the smiles of new friends, the hope blossoming inside.
My happiest memories have no place in the past; they are those I have yet to create." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "You were a summer gift, one I'll always treasure. You were a dream I never wanted to wake up from. You opened my eyes to things I'll never really see. You're the best thing that will ever happen to me." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description:
"Losing It
Some days I think I'm losing my mind. What seems so clear most of the time becomes a big question mark. Am I really the way I percieve myself, or is the person others see the truth of me? I wait for answers, but inside I know I have to go out and find them. And answers like knowledge, are not always where we first look for them." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "Torch every book. Burn every page. Char every word to ash. Ideas are incombustible. And therein lies your real fear." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "Eyes Tell Stories But do they know how to craft fiction? Do they know how to spin lies? His eyes swear forever, flatter with vows of only me. But are they empty promises? I stare into his eyes, as into a crystal ball, but I cannot find forever, only movies of yesterday, a sketchbook of today, dreams of a shared tomorrow. His eyes whisper secrets. But are they truths or fairy tales? I wonder if even he knows." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description:
"Isn't it ironic . . . we ignore those who adore us, adore those who ignore us, hurt those who love us, and love those who hurt us.
Every flaw he held and every perfection he flaunted made her love him even more.
"I hate this feeling. Like I'm here, but I'm not. Like someone cares. But they don't. Like I belong somewhere else, anywhere but here, and escape lies just past that snowy window, cool and crisp as the February air." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "I'm in love. And I like how that feels. And I hate how that feels. Because love is an invention of fiction writers." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description:
"Girls get screwed. Not that kind of screwed, what I mean is, they're always on the short end of things.
The way things work, how guys feel great, but make girls feel cheap for doing exactly what they beg for.
The way they get to play you, all the while claiming they love you and making you believe it's true.
The way it's okay to gift their heart one day, a backhand the next, to move on to the apricot when the peach blushes and bruises.
These things make me believe God's a man after all." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "All I can do is lie here, brain turning somersaults. It's nights like these when memories stir, whipping themselves into stiff peaks of pain." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "I don't love him, & he definitely doesn't love me. Still, he semi-fills a gaping black hole inside me. That place wants love, maybe even needs love, but love is something I"m pretty sure doesn't exist." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "Happily ever after is a concept I'll never believe in." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "I am different. And I don't understand exactly how. And I don't understand just why." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "All I know is I love how it feels. And I know I'm going to lose that feeling, just like I've lost everything important in my life." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "Sometimes I'm not so sure just who I am either." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Princess add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Princess add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Princess add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally. " -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Princess add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Right now I’m having amnesia and déjà vu at the same time. I think I’ve forgotten this before." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Princess add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Princess add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Princess add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Princess add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you, not knowing how blind that was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Princess add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Don’t grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form." -- Rumi

item.title: Princess add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "Let the lover be disgraceful, crazy, absentminded. Someone sober will worry about things going badly. Let the lover be. " -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
